column11:
This table shows the Fall 2024 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It details undergraduate and graduate teaching activity, includes graduate “extra credit” adjustments, and converts totals into standardized FTEs.

By School (Fall 2024):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest contributor with 50,926 total credit hours, equating to about 3,252 FTEs.

Business – produced 14,550 credit hours and 852 FTEs.

Education – generated 5,336 credit hours, a smaller share, for 158 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences – contributed 10,557 credit hours, supporting 478 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – second-largest with 35,752 credit hours, translating into 2,226 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – instructional load by level.

Graduate Extra Credit – weighting added to graduate instruction.

Grand Total Credit Hours – overall credit count including adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollment counts (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
